remarks.p: The OSCAL assessment results format is used to describe the information typically provided by an assessor following an assessment.
The root of the OSCAL assessment results format is assessment-results.

define-assembly.name: assessment-results
define-assembly.description: Security assessment results, such as those provided by a FedRAMP assessor in the FedRAMP Security Assessment Report.

remarks.p: Used by the SAR to import information about the original plan for assessing the system.

define-assembly.name: assessment-subjects
define-assembly.description: Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and locations. In the assessment plan, this identifies the planned assessment subject. In the assessment results this is the actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes from the plan.

define-assembly.name: local-definitions
define-assembly.description: Allows control objectives, users, components, and inventory-items to be defined within the assessment plan or assessment results for circumstances where they are not appropriately defined in the SSP. NOTE: Use the assessment plan or assessment results metadata to define additional locations if needed.

remarks.p: Used to add any components, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Used to add any inventory-items, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Used to add any users, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
